title: Major tech firms agree to AI safeguards set by the White House
description: Biden announced on Friday that his administration has secured voluntary commitments from seven US companies meant to ensure that their AI products are safe before they release them.

title: Brazil's Lula places new restrictions on gun ownership, undoing Bolsonaro's legacy
description: President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva on Friday, July 21, signed an executive order tightening civilian access to firearms.

title: Henrique Vieira: Evangelical pastor, radical left-wing MP
description: The Brazilian clergyman poses in favor of secularism and the decriminalization of abortion, and is opposed to fundamentalism of any kind. His mission: To rally the faithful of an ultraconservative community to his cause.

title: Paris explosion: Death toll climbs to 3
description: One person remained missing and six people were in intensive care after a blast that destroyed a building in central Paris on the afternoon of June, 21. The French capital’s historic infrastructure has seen occasional gas explosions in the past.

title: 'In people's minds, women can't be pilots'
description: French aviation has 10% female license holders. Despite numerous initiatives to feminize the profession, sexism persists.

title: Trial in Trump classified documents case set for May 2024
description: Trump's lawyers had resisted setting a date but said any trial should take place after the November 2024 US presidential election.

title: Spain campaign draws to close ahead of Sunday vote
description: Final opinion polls allowed under Spanish law tipped the right-wing Popular Party (PP) to win the most seats.

title: More than 50 pilot whales died following mass stranding in Scotland
description: Post-mortem examinations are underway and should determine in the coming weeks whether human activities had anything to do with this incident.

title: Activist fund Bluebell puts luxury group Kering under pressure
description: The London-based investment fund has acquired a stake in the luxury goods group chaired by François-Henri Pinault. It has raised hopes of a merger with Richemont to create a real challenger to LVMH.

title: Russian former separatist commander detained on 'extremism' charges
description: Igor Strelkov was arrested and brought into a Moscow court after having repeatedly criticized Russian President Vladimir Putin on social media. He faces up to five years in prison.

title: London police should not have arrested French publisher, independent review says
description: Police officers should not have used counter-terrorism powers to question and detain  Ernest Moret earlier this year, the independent reviewer of terrorism legislation said.

title: Investigation: How Russia and China are arming Myanmar's military junta
description: Le Monde and the NGO Myanmar Witness investigated the abuses committed by Myanmar's military junta since its coup on February 1, 2021, along with weapons deliveries from Russia and China that have made their attacks possible.

title: Tour de France: Mohoric wins photo finish for stage 19
description: The Slovenian rider Matej Mohoric beat the previous day's winner Kasper Asgreen by just a few centimeters.

title: Tunisia: Evicted and attacked, sub-Saharan migrants flee Sfax
description: The death of a young Tunisian man sparked attacks against migrants in Tunisia since the beginning of July, but the outbreak of hatred comes after months of tension.

title: India: Vile attack caught on video rekindles violence in Manipur
description: The small northeastern state has been gripped by inter-ethnic and religious conflict between the Meitei and the Kuki for nearly three months, and is on the brink of civil war.

title: With elections approaching, ambitious EU commissioners look for jobs
description: Frans Timmermans has announced that he wants to head a coalition in the Dutch elections in the autumn of 2023. He is the third member of the Commission to announce their (probable) departure in recent weeks.

title: Macron says reshuffle reflects wish for 'continuity'
description: The French president laid out his priorities for the coming months, at the first cabinet meeting after a small government reshuffle.

title: Tony Bennett, last of classic American crooners, dead at 96
description: When he was 88, Bennett became the oldest person ever to reach number one on the US album sales chart. He died in New York, on Friday.

title: The French government's strange reshuffle
description: By getting rid of ministers with little political background and promoting longtime allies, the government looks more professional. But it remains short of a roadmap.

title: The Tour de France offers a global showcase for the 'Capital of Comté'
description: Poligny, in the region famous for Comté cheese, will host the finish line of the competition's 19th stage on Friday, July 21. The small town of 4,000 in eastern France is hoping for major economic benefits.

title: 'Ceviche in Peru is everywhere, all the time'
description: 'A world of street food' (5/6). Six chefs reveal how they have adapted a basic foreign dish to French tastes and ingredients. In Paris, Javier Jimenez Morales and Claudia Perez Vasquez-Solis serve ceviche as they do in Lima: as fresh as can be, for eating on the go, but with a little less spice, to suit the French palate.

title: Sweden moves Iraq embassy operations to Stockholm
description: Sweden's embassy in Baghdad was stormed Thursday by protesters angered about a planned burning of a Quran in Stockholm.

title: After Quran desecration in Sweden, Iraqi political leaders fan flames
description: Salwan Momika, an Iraqi refugee, did not burn a Quran in front of the Iraqi embassy in Stockholm after all, but demonstrators nevertheless stormed and set fire to the Swedish embassy in Baghdad.

title: French government reshuffle: Eight new ministers in a more political team
description: The reshuffle signals the failure of non-political figures appointed 2022, who have been replaced by more traditional MPs and Macron loyalists.

title: Zelensky sacks ambassador to UK after criticism
description: The ambassador, Vadym Prystaiko, had criticized the Ukrainian president's response to a row over British military aid.

title: Economic difficulties emerge as key topic in Spain's early elections
description: Inflation and rising interest rates are overshadowing the positive macroeconomic results achieved by Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez's Spanish Socialist Workers' Party government.

title: UK Conservatives hold on to Boris Johnson's former seat, lose 2 out of 3 by-elections
description: If Britain's Conservative Party held the former parliamentary seat of the ex-Prime Minister, it has lost two others in a major blow to its ruling government.

title: A production of 'La Bohème' invites political controversy to an Italian festival
description: Adapted to the May 1968 Zeitgeist, the staging by French director Christophe Gayral provoked tensions with conductor Alberto Veronesi. The latter is supported by Vittorio Sgarbi, undersecretary for culture in the government of far-right leader Giorgia Meloni.

title: NASA deems July likely to be the warmest month 'in hundreds of years'
description: Scientist Gavin Schmidt's July 20 declaration comes as the world has been buffeted by fires and dire health warnings in the past week, in addition to broken temperature records.

title: Macron reshuffles without looking to the right
description: Unlike in previous government reshuffles, the right-wing party Les Républicains was snubbed from joining Emmanuel Macron's coalition.

title: Police seized items from home of witness to Tupac Shakur's death
description: Las Vegas detectives sought items 'concerning the murder of Tupac' from Duane "Keffe D" Davis, according to warrant documents released on Thursday, July 20.

title: The strange disappearance of China's foreign minister
description: China's chief diplomat, Qin Gang, has not made a public appearance since June 25. His predecessor, Wang Yi, a member of the CPC Political Bureau, has been taking his place on official visits. The ministry has unconvincingly attributed Qin's absence to 'health reasons.'
